doc.name: mobileStoreMakePurchase
doc.summary: Create and send a request for a new purchase

description.overview: Use the mobileStoreMakePurchase command to create and send a request for a new purchase

parameter.name: productId
parameter.description: Is the identifier of the requested item.

parameter.name: quantity
parameter.description: Is the quantity of the in-app purchase to buy (default 1 - iOS only)

parameter.name: developerPayload
parameter.description: Is a string of less than 256 characters that will be returned with the purchase details once complete. It can be used to later identify a purchase response to a specific request. It defaults to empty (Android only)

description.comments:
The command mobileStoreMakePurchase is used to create and send a request for a new purchase.
The productId is the identifier of the in-app purchase you created in the vendor's App Store and wish to buy.
The quantity is the the quantity of the in-app purchase to buy. This is used only for iOS, and should be used only on consumable items. For Android, you must set this to "1". If you want to buy more than one consumable item, you have to do it manually (i.e one by one).
The developerPayload is string that contains some extra information on the purchase. It is used only for Android stores.
Before calling mobileStoreMakePurchase command, you have to set the product type (using mobileStoreSetProductType), as well as to enable receipt of purchaseStateUpdate messages (using mobileStoreEnablePurchaseUpdates)
